page.title: 04Threave Estate
page.content: Threave Estate used to belong to Major A E Gordon. It was presented to the National Trust in 1948. The late Major Gordon insisted that the wildfowl should be preserved. In winter, lots of birds such as geese and ducks come to the River Dee. The National Trust has put up a new bird hide because the old one was beginning to rot. In summer, ducks, pheasants and pigeons nest on Threave Island. One year the island was flooded and most of the rabbits were drowned. Now there are only a few rabbits left on the island. The estate itself includes four dairy farms and 94 acres of woodland.
